title: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park: Science & Research
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Science & Research             Science & Research                   Hop into toad breeding surveys               Dig into park archeology               On the hunt for bats               Explore over 100 years of change with...               Monitoring environmental factors         Â    Science and Research at a Historical Park? You bet!  At Klondike Gold Rush, we have biologists, historians, preservationists, curators, and archaeologists all working with the natural and cultural resources protected by the park.    Learn more about these areas of research:    archeology bats  amphibians lichens  invasive plants site preservation air quality climate change        Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park is part of the Southeast Alaska Inventory and Monitoring Network (SEAN) along with Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve and Sitka National Historical Park.  SEAN uses long-term scientific research to better understand park ecosystems and help park managers.
